required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluating System Accuracy of Blood Glucose Monitoring Systems for Self-testing in Managing Diabetes Mellitus
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating System Accuracy of Blood Glucose Monitoring Systems for Self-testing in Managing Diabetes Mellitus [Following EN ISO 15197:2003 - 7.3 System Accuracy Evaluation] Part 40 of Study IDT-2010

lead_sponsor.agency: Institut für Diabetes-Technologie Forschungs- und Entwicklungsgesellschaft mbH an der Universität Ulm

clinical_study.source: Institut für Diabetes-Technologie Forschungs- und Entwicklungsgesellschaft mbH an der Universität Ulm

brief_summary.textblock: In this clinical trial an evaluation of a blood glucose monitoring system (BGStar) and several POCT (point-of-care testing) devices against two laboratory methods will be performed. This evaluation will be performed according to ISO (International Organization for Standardization) 15197 System Accuracy.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of System Accuracy according to ISO 15197

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years of age or older
- People with diabetes Typ 1 or Typ 2 and people without diabetes
- for BG adjustment people with diabetes Typ 1 or Typ 2
- informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnancy or lactation period
- severe acute diseases
- severe chronic diseases

facility.name: Institut für Diabetes-Technologie Forschungs- und Entwicklungsgesellschaft mbH an der Universität Ulm
